entry.tran: （学校在学年末举行的）正式舞会
entry.def: A prom is a formal dance at a school or college which is usually held at the end of the academic year.

example.ex: I didn't want to go to the prom with Craig.
example.tran: 我不想和克雷格一起参加学年末的舞会。

entry.def: The prom is the road by the sea where people go for a walk.
The Proms are a series of concerts of mainly classical music that are held each year in London and some other cities. There is usually an area at these concerts where people stand, as well as seats.

example.ex: ...his final Prom performance of Elgar's First Symphony.
example.tran: 逍遥音乐会上他的压轴曲目——埃尔加的《第一交响曲》
